_header: It belimpeth for to speak to readen and to sing
_description: A prayer to God (with the Pater Noster as its basis) — nine monorhyming quatrains

OxfCCC59.First Lines:
Hit bilimpeð forte speke to reden & to singeOf him þe
                    no mon mai at reke king of alle kinge…
OxfCCC59.Last Lines:
…mid þicke speche & false spare & mid
                    lesingeþu ert hele & help & lif & king of alle
                    kinge
OxfCCC59.Note:
MS incorrectly identified by Morris as CCCO 54 instead of
                    59.
